enigma_edit.model

Class World

  • java.lang.Object
    • enigma_edit.model.World

  • public class World
extends java.lang.Object
    A world as it is constructed from lua code. This class takes only a String of lua code from which all necessary data is constructed. First a CodeAnalyser will be used to analyse the given source code. Then each field of the level will be computed by calling WoCall.getTile(int, int) which in turn uses the given resolver instance. At last the thus determined tile declaration is converted to a ImageTile by the constructor of this class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • World

        public World(java.lang.String code)
        Creates a world from lua code. The constructor does not analyse the code yet. You will have to call analyse(enigma_edit.model.Tileset) to manually start the analysis.
        Parameters:
        code - The world's source code. Typically this is the content of the <luamain> tag.

    • Method Detail

      • isAnalysed

        public boolean isAnalysed()
        Check, if the given source code has been analysed.
        Returns:
        true, if analyse has been called.

      • getWidth

        public int getWidth()
        Get the world's width (in tiles).

      • getHeight

        public int getHeight()
        Get the world's height (in tiles).

      • getTile

        public ImageTile getTile(int x,
                         int y)
        Get tile from position.
        Parameters:
        x - X coordinate of the field (1 <= x <= width)
        y - Y coordinate of the field (1 <= y <= height)
        Returns:
        Tile at the specified position (x,y).

      • resetCode

        public void resetCode(java.lang.String code)
               throws org.luaj.vm2.parser.ParseException,
                      LevelLuaException
        Change the world source code to the given string (without re-analysis). For the analysis of the new code an explicit call to analyse(enigma_edit.model.Tileset) is necessary.
        Parameters:
        code - New lua source code.
        Throws:
        org.luaj.vm2.parser.ParseException - This indicates a lua syntax error (thrown by the parser).
        LevelLuaException - This indicates special runtime errors or constructs, that are illegal in Enigma levels (thrown by the analyser).

      • resetCode

        public boolean resetCode(java.lang.String code,
                         Tileset tileset)
                  throws org.luaj.vm2.parser.ParseException,
                         LevelLuaException
        Change the world source code to the given string. If the previously given code was already analysed, the new code will be analysed as well. Otherwise an explicit call to analyse(enigma_edit.model.Tileset) is necessary.
        Parameters:
        code - New lua source code.
        tileset - ImageTile set used during analysis for sprite caching.
        Returns:
        true, if the new code was analysed.
        Throws:
        org.luaj.vm2.parser.ParseException - This indicates a lua syntax error (thrown by the parser).
        LevelLuaException - This indicates special runtime errors or constructs, that are illegal in Enigma levels (thrown by the analyser).

      • analyse

        public void analyse(Tileset tileset)
             throws org.luaj.vm2.parser.ParseException,
                    LevelLuaException
        Execute a code analysis. The given code will be analysed by a CodeAnalyser. Then all cells of the world will be resolved by the Resolver given to the wo() call.
        Parameters:
        tileset - ImageTile set used for sprite caching.
        Throws:
        org.luaj.vm2.parser.ParseException - This indicates a lua syntax error (thrown by the parser).
        LevelLuaException - This indicates special runtime errors or constructs, that are illegal in Enigma levels (thrown by the analyser).
